greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of (Product_{k>0} (1 - x^k) / (1 - x^(5*k)))^5 in powers of x.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of q^(5/6) * eta(q)^5 / eta(q^5)^5 in powers of q. - _Michael Somos_, Apr 29 2017
Expansion of f(-x)^5 / f(-x^5)^5 in powers of x where f() is a Ramanujan theta function. - _Michael Somos_, Apr 29 2017
Euler transform of period 5 sequence [-5, -5, -5, -5, 0, ...]. - _Michael Somos_, Apr 29 2017
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ QPochhammer[ x]^5 / QPochhammer[ x^5]^5, {x, 0, n}]; (* _Michael Somos_, Apr 29 2017 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( (eta(x + A) / eta(x^5 + A))^5, n))}; /* _Michael Somos_, Apr 29 2017 */
results.author: _Seiichi Manyama_, Apr 29 2017
